programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A Peugeot driver tries to give interceptor Ky Kirk the slip around the bumpy backstreets of Nottingham, leading Ky to send out an SOS to colleagues Rob and Dan. Ken and Adam spot a shifty lad taking a sneaky photo of them on his phone and, when they stop him and his mate, they're clean, but the interceptors suspect they are at risk of child criminal exploitation
S20E03

programme.title: Westbound (1959)
programme.desc: A former Union soldier is employed by a stagecoach company to guard a large gold shipment being transported across the country. Meanwhile, a loyal follower of the defeated Confederacy is plotting to steal the bullion to revive the cause, but his plans are confounded by traitorous henchmen and his wife, who was once the lover of the Union veteran. Western, with Randolph Scott, Andrew Duggan and Virginia Mayo

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Chris finds himself on the tail of a runaway Renault Clio, while Rob and Dan receive intel that a residential home is emitting a familiar aroma of marijuana. Meanwhile, the Knife Crime Team head out in force to the northern suburbs, where they suspect a drug-deal is about to happen. After a highly co-ordinated operation, the team smoke out the suspected main dealer and a search turns up almost 100 wraps of Class A's down his pants

programme.title: Sudden Impact (1983)
programme.desc: Maverick detective 'Dirty' Harry Callahan is sent to investigate a killing in a small town when his superiors tire of his no-holds barred approach to law enforcement. The case takes an unexpected turn with the discovery that the killer is a woman seeking revenge on the men who raped her and her sister 10 years previously. Crime thriller sequel, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Sondra Locke, Pat Hingle and Bradford Dillman

programme.title: Universal Soldier (1992)
programme.desc: A government project succeeds in reanimating dead soldiers to form an expendable combat unit for dangerous missions. However, when two of the resurrected squad members experience flashbacks of their previous lives, they remember they had killed each other and continue the conflict where they left off. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren and Ally Walker

programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
In one of the fastest pursuits in interceptor history, units mobilise to try to stop a 185mph superbike that is pulling wheelies, giving stinger teams the run-around, and even testing the flying skills of the National Police Air Support Unit. With the lives of other motorists at risk, the last resort is authority for tactical contact between cop car and the motorbike, but can advanced driver Paul Charlesworth pull it off?
S22E02

programme.title: Banged Up: HMP Wakefield
programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. Exclusive phone calls from one of the UK's longest-serving inmates, Charles Bronson, reveal first-hand what life is really like as inmate in Wakefield Prison, and there are never-before-told stories from inside the walls of Wakefield about Jeremy Bamber, arguably as famous for his fight to get out of prison as for the crimes he committed to be sent there

programme.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet

programme.title: Dances with Wolves (1990)
programme.desc: A Union army officer during the American Civil War requests a posting to a remote outpost on the frontier. Left to man a deserted fort single-handedly, he is gradually adopted into a local Sioux tribe - but they are endangered when his former comrades come looking for him. Oscar-winning Western, directed by and starring Kevin Costner. With Mary McDonnell, Graham Greene, Rodney A Grant and Floyd Red Crow Westerman

programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 24/05/2023: Jon Kay and Nina Warhurst round-up the national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Angela, Gloria and Julia tackle the appliance cover policies that aren't worth a penny and the trade finder website that doesn't do the checks it should. Plus, smart meter advice
S15E08

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
The Defenders uncover a human trafficking and modern slavery operation in a Bristol car wash and investigate the illegal selling of deadly diet pills on the dark web
S05E08

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Dion Dublin heads to his old stomping ground, near Stratford-upon-Avon, to see an intriguing lot consisting of 16 garages. Tommy Walsh is in Wolverhampton looking at a three-bedroom detached property, and Martel Maxwell is in Sunderland where a four-bedroom mid-terrace has a bit of a damp problem
S24E42

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Peterborough 13: Stephanie Connell and Philip Serrell help teams search for items at the Peterborough Festival of Antiques, while Eric Knowles views a horseshoe collection at Oakham Castle, Rutland
S55E06

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Monstrous Regimen of Women: Bear's encounter with the police takes an unexpected turn and Scarlett and Ollie's latest prank takes a wrong turn. Zara and Emma help a woman confront a care home
S24E69

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
Sarah visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey where she finds an Edwardian armchair, a dated display cabinet and a collection of costume jewellery for her and the team to upcycle
S14E05

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Cambridgeshire: Margherita Taylor meets a pregnant couple who are returning to the UK after seven years in Switzerland and looking for a family home in Cambridgeshire. Away from the search, Margherita also visits one of the country's largest solar farms to learn how generating renewable energy can be compatible with grazing livestock
S22E40

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc:
The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event
S2023E05

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
The artisans team up to restore a reclining armchair and a frog-shaped clock, while leather expert Suzie Fletcher is right at home reviving a tired old saddler's stitching stool
S09E13

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan
S28E13

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc:
The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event
S2023E06

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben struggles to accept Lola's prognosis and accuses the family of accepting it too easily, after a heart to heart with Phil he starts to see the error in his ways. Tensions in the Slater household continue to rise and Freddie receives an ADHD referral. Plus, there is a glimmer of hope for Chelsea and Ravi's relationship

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
A Gloucestershire woman brings in her King Charles II painting, hoping Lucia Scalisi can restore it to its crowning glory, and silversmith Brenton West works on a well-travelled trunk, which holds cherished memories for a mother and daughter. Goldsmith Richard Talman tries to reunite the broken pieces of an engagement ring and toy restorers Julie and Amanda revive a toy donkey that comforted a young child after he lost his mother and his sister
S08E01

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details
S09E01

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc:
Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. Dannii Minogue gathers the boys for their first Chemistry Test to couples discover what brings them together and what moves them apart
S01E03

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc:
Dannii Minogue shakes things up by welcoming three single men into the masseria, to see if some of the couples who have matched up are as devoted as they appear. While the new arrivals throw some serious moves at the party, Josh takes a break to reveal something important to Mikey before the boys all weigh up their options for the second Kiss-Off
S01E04

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 25/05/2023: Charlie Stayt and Tina Daheley present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon get to grips with the tricky problem of compostable and biodegradable packaging. Plus, the delivery companies letting down disabled customers
S15E09

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc:
The impact that thefts and break-ins have on life in rural communities and how security systems that don't rely on a good internet connection are now helping to protect businesses in such areas. Presenter Rav Wilding also looks at how data captured by mobile phone masts helped bring a pair of prolific burglars to justice and how smart number plate recognition cameras can detect when a car is on false plates
S03E09

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc:
Investigators examine the death of a worker at one of the UK's largest recycling plants. They seize more than 300 hours' worth of CCTV footage that shows dangerous work practices and breaches in health and safety in the days running up to the tragedy. Plus, efforts are made to catch a trader selling chocolate bars with a fake list of ingredients, putting children's health at risk
S05E09

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
A terraced house in the Merseyside town of Birkenhead, a large period property in Ramsgate, Kent, and a one-bedroom flat in a smart block in Kingston-upon-Hull are all sold at online auctions. One is destined for the rental market, one as a holiday home and the other as their home. Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin assess their potential in realising their owners' ambitions
S26E26

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Shrewsbury 24: Caroline Hawley presents the show from Shrewsbury, Shropshire, and visits RAF Cosford to learn about a team of Spitfire-flying women. With experts Thomas Forrester and Mark Stacey
S62E25

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
Starting Fires: Jimmi's patient Jay takes a chance on a new relationship. However, things go from bad to worse. Medical drama set in a busy Midlands surgery, with Adrian Lewis Morgan
S24E70

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc:
Sarah Moore visits Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, searching for three items with the potential to be revived. She saves a pine chest of drawers for carpenter Martin Hough and a trio of utility chairs for upcycler Sarah Peterson. Sarah takes on a set of trestle table bases for her own project
S14E06

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Gloucestershire: A creative couple from London want to leave city life behind in search of new adventures in Gloucestershire, so Chris Bavin presents them with a selection of houses to guide them. Away from the search, Chris also visits a local football club which is green by name and green by nature
S22E42

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc:
Angellica Bell chats to YouTube and Strictly star Joe Sugg about his new-found passion for gardening and James Wong shares his beginners' guide to growing houseplants
S2023E08

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Sarah Readings presents a very well-loved and very well-travelled companion in need of help from soft toy experts Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell. This little doll of a sailor was named Fairstar after the ship he was bought on, and the ship that carried Sarah and her parents to Australia in the 1960s as 'Ten Pound Poms' - people encouraged to emigrate to Australia by the government with cheap fares. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

programme.desc:

It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc:
On the eve of its final day, Sophie Raworth and Joe Swift reveal the winner of the BBC RHS People's Choice Award. Mary Berry asks the pavilion growers how best to create a stunning floral cutting garden, Adam Frost and Toby Buckland review the top planting trends that have emerged at this year's show, while Frances Tophill showcases the cocktails that can be made using botanicals and herbs grown at home

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
Imaginations run wild in this semi-final as the contestants' latest brief is to cook a dish both 'theatrical and fantastical' in nature. The hopefuls need to create a dish that pushes boundaries, playing with both mind and senses. Later, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace have to determine who warrants contesting Finals Week

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc:
Dom and Kay get in touch with a woman known as Thirsty Kirsty via a dating app on Clinton's phone, hoping she can help extract them from the mess they are in. They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker and Katherine Kelly
S01E04

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc:
Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie hilariously poke fun at life with celebrity guests. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house
S02E03

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc:
Jellyfish: Madison and Oly attend a protest rampage, dragging a nervous Michael along for the ride. Oly's hangover leads to a big parenting fail, while a confusing encounter between Jacinda and Santi's new girlfriend distracts her away from Reema's return from London. Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr
S03E03

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc:
The Argentine: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris
S03E04

programme.title: The Photograph (2020)
programme.desc: Michael, a reporter, becomes fascinated by a picture of a woman, and wants to know her backstory. In the present day, following the death of her estranged mother, a devastated young woman finds a photo that will change her life forever. Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Upper Teesdale: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area
S2023E22

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Powis Castle & Garden, Welshpool 1: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes
S01E02

The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes
S19E20

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
After several gruelling challenges, Gordon knows that all his finalists have what it takes to partner up with him. It's now time to drill down on their businesses and find out whose product is worthy of his endorsement. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment
S02E08

Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

They arrange to meet the mysterious contact they suspect is also operating undercover as they set about investigating the seemingly shady Superintendent Edwards by breaking into her office. Meanwhile, a revelation from PCSO Pricey causes Dom to believe that Clinton may not have been what he seemed. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker and Katherine Kelly

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc:

Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. Gordon invites the final three contenders to Ibrox Stadium in Glasgow, a place that saw him forced to end his football career with Rangers and turn his hand to food. There they are tasked to create a Scottish-limited edition of their products to launch in front of a home crowd. They then face the most dramatic grilling of their lives, as each tries to convince Gordon to back them with a £150,000 investment

Keeks accidently sees Santi with Jacinda as she gets her coffee, so she assumes an identity that creates some confusion. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris, Ava Cannon and Carlos Sanson Jr
S03E03

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc:
The Argentine: Things have never been worse between Santi and Oly, who aren't talking to each other. At Pica del Sabor, Bernardita's friendliness with a customer leads to a noisy showdown. Oly is alarmed when Jacinda starts spouting Bible quotes and having nightmares about burning in Hell, and angrily assumes Bernardita is to blame. When Oly learns Santi secretly enrolled Jacinda in Catholic Scripture at school, she's furious and overlooks the inconvenient fact that it was Angie who told Jacinda about Hell. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

Writer/director Stella Meghie's drama, starring Issa Rae, LaKeith Stanfield and Chelsea Peretti

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Food and Shopping: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips
S01E05

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Small: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science
S01E01

programme.title: Lucky Sunil
programme.desc: Andrew Davies's satirical drama telling the story of Sunil, an Indian law student who travels to London in the hope of making it big. But he finds his new life is not quite as easy as he expected it to be, and descends into a world of hefty debts and dodgy deals among Britain's Asian emigres. Starring Kulvinder Ghir. Originally broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Food and Shopping: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips
S01E05

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Small: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science
S01E01

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
A Touch of Class: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture
S01E06

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Mighty Cathedrals: Fred uncovers the construction techniques of stonemasons and carpenters through the ages, focusing on Norman cathedrals. The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble today's demolition methods
S01E01

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the house's fortunes in the 18th and 19th centuries. He begins by investigating the death of owner Joseph Holbrook, and discovering why his daughter was written out of the will. A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum
S03E02

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg talks to John Wilson about the influences that shaped her career, including her earliest experiences of acting with a children's community project in New York, and being encouraged by her mother to make the most of free cultural opportunities in the city

programme.title: The Color Purple (1985)
programme.desc: A much-abused black woman is separated from her children and her sister, and doomed to a life of virtual slavery at the hands of her brutish new husband on an impoverished farm in rural Georgia. Steven Spielberg's drama, based on Alice Walker's novel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Danny Glover, Oprah Winfrey, Margaret Avery and Willard E Pugh

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Venice: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice
S01E02

programme.title: Hans Zimmer: Hollywood Rebel
programme.desc: Profile of the Oscar-winning composer responsible for some of the best-loved film and TV scores of the past few decades. Contributors include directors Christopher Nolan, Denis Villeneuve, and Steve McQueen. In this portrait, Zimmer reveals the musical secrets of his craft - how he goes about terrifying, moving and raising people's spirits through his work

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
A Touch of Class: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture
S01E06

The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble today's demolition methods
S01E01

A later resident of the home rises to become mayor in the 1830s, but had to find a way to prevent riots that had ravaged the city years earlier from occurring again. David also delves into the life of a servant who worked in the house in the 1870s, only to leave domestic servitude for an abusive marriage, and discovers how a successful teacher who later owned the house ended up committed to an asylum
S03E02

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Punt and Hugh Dennis present chart hits from October 6, 1994, in a selection of studio performances and videos from CJ Lewis, Cyndi Lauper, Madonna, Michelle Gayle, Bon Jovi, Elton John, Take That, Inxs and Whigfield. Plus, a vintage clip of the Stranglers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents music from October 13, 1994, by PJ & Duncan, Cappella, Gloria Estefan, Snap featuring Summer, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, Pato Banton, Two Thirds, Sting and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 27/05/1982: John Peel presents the edition from May 27, featuring music by Debbie Harry, Genesis, Japan, Soft Cell, Duran Duran and Madness

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 24/05/1979: David Jensen presents an edition from May 24, 1979, with performances by the Skids, Roxy Music, ELO, Tubeway Army, Liner, the Damned, Dollar, David Bowie, the Shadows, Blondie and Elvis Costello and the Attractions

programme.title: Cilla at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable TV appearances by Cilla Black from the BBC archives. The much-missed performer began her presenting career in 1968 on the BBC, having already become one of Britain's most popular singers. The programme features her appearances on Not Only, But Also, The Ken Dodd Show, Top of the Pops and The Royal Variety Performance as well as her self-titled series, plus her famous 1973 duet with Marc Bolan

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc:
The Singer and the Song: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt
S01E07

programme.title: Dusty
programme.desc:
22/08/1967: Entertainment showcase with host Dusty Springfield and her backing band of Madeline Bell, Lesley Duncan and Maggie Stredder. With special guest Mel Torme. First aired in August 1967
S02E02

programme.title: Lulu's Back in Town
programme.desc: Archive performances by the Scottish singer of songs including Trolley Song, Suddenly You Love Me and Lulu's Back in Town, accompanied by backing group the Ladybirds. Featuring the Everly Brothers, who perform Bye Bye Love, and a comedy routine by Les Dawson

programme.title: Sir Cliff Richard at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back through the BBC archives at some of the singer's most memorable performances and biggest hits. Amongst the classic songs featured are Move It, The Young Ones, Living Doll, Bachelor Boy, the Eurovision Song Contest contenders Congratulations and Power to All Our Friends, Devil Woman, Miss You Nights, Wired for Sound and Cliff's much-praised 1980s duet with Van Morrison, Wherever God Shines His Light

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Punt and Hugh Dennis present chart hits from October 6, 1994, in a selection of studio performances and videos from CJ Lewis, Cyndi Lauper, Madonna, Michelle Gayle, Bon Jovi, Elton John, Take That, Inxs and Whigfield. Plus, a vintage clip of the Stranglers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents music from October 13, 1994, by PJ & Duncan, Cappella, Gloria Estefan, Snap featuring Summer, Lisa Loeb and Nine Stories, Pato Banton, Two Thirds, Sting and Take That

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 27/05/1982: John Peel presents the edition from May 27, featuring music by Debbie Harry, Genesis, Japan, Soft Cell, Duran Duran and Madness

The programme features her appearances on Not Only, But Also, The Ken Dodd Show, Top of the Pops and The Royal Variety Performance as well as her self-titled series, plus her famous 1973 duet with Marc Bolan

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc:
The Singer and the Song: Archive clips featuring solo artists, including music by performers as diverse as Sandie Shaw, Dusty Springfield, Long John Baldry, Lulu, Tom Jones, Brenton Wood, Cliff Richard, Cilla Black and Peter Sarstedt
S01E07

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Bhutan to the Bay of Bengal: Michael's journey takes him to Bhutan, where he enjoys a last glimpse of the Himalaya before heading to Paro to enjoy a Buddhist festival. Here he witnesses archery contests and the unfolding of a giant scroll during the night of a full moon
S01E06

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc:
Michael Palin Meets Jan Morris: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life
S04E02

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
Battle for the Himalayas: The Fight to Film Everest: Documentary charting the story of how film-makers used the Himalayan mountains for propaganda, as the world's great powers sent military-style expeditions to conquer the peaks between the 1920s and the 1960s. As a result, some of the range's most iconic mountaineering feats have been captured on film, including the preparations for Mallory and Irvine ill-fated ascent of Mount Everest in 1924, and the final conquest of the mountain by Hillary and Tenzing in 1953
S14E04

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Patient Pathway: Arild secretly struggles, Jorund develops health anxiety and Finn decides the time has come to turn his life around. Ester learns what chemotherapy involves. In Norwegian
S01E03

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
The Wedding: Ester begins chemotherapy, as two of her closest friends tie the knot and her teenage son Lars falls in love. Jorund is still convinced there must be something wrong with him and orders a full medical examination. In Norwegian
S01E04

programme.title: A Little Chaos (2014)
programme.desc: A female landscape designer in 17th-century France challenges boundaries of class and gender when she is chosen by King Louis XIV to create a new garden for the palace of Versailles. She becomes romantically involved with a fellow designer, whose creative philosophy is the opposite of hers. Period drama, starring Kate Winslet, Matthias Schoenaerts, Stanley Tucci and Alan Rickman, who also directed

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Cruise: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E06

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
I'll Never Forget Whatshername: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars
S01E05

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Crisis: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers
S01E03

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc:
Michael Palin Meets Jan Morris: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life
S04E02

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Gilbert and Sullivan's Yeoman of the Guard
programme.desc: English National Opera's new production of the much-loved Gilbert & Sullivan classic, a fast-paced caper set in the Tower of London, with the action shifted to the 1950s, the time of the Queen's coronation. Colonel Fairfax is under sentence of death. Can his old friend, the Beefeater Sergeant Merryl, save him? And what of Merryl's daughter Phoebe, who has fallen hopelessly in love with the colonel? Anthony Gregory and Neal Davies lead the cast, with the Orchestra & Chorus of ENO conducted by Chris Hopkins

programme.title: Cilla in Scandinavia
programme.desc: Cilla Black hosts a 1971 show specially recorded in Stockholm on Midsummer's Day and on film locations in Norway, Sweden and Finland. Guests include Ringo Starr, Sven-Bertil Taube, Basil Brush, Hannu Mikkola and Marvin, Welch & Farrar

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Archive performances by Cilla Black, who sings Step Inside Love, For Once in My Life and Liverpool Lullaby. She also duets with Georrgie Fame and Dusty Springfield, and there's a comedy sketch from Graeme Garden, Tim Brooke-Taylor and Graham Chapman

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Trade & Romance: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding
S01E03

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way, to mark the 50th anniversary of Britain's first national trail being officially opened. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Art of Castle Building: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England
S01E02

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Florence: Using 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of the city's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room
S01E03

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Glasgow: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history
S02E01

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc:
Crewing Up: Film-maker Chris Terrill captures an intimate and personal portrait of life on board ultra-modern super aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth, as its crew learns the intricacies of a warship that will change the way Britain goes to war. In this first instalment, early 2016 sees sailors begin to arrive in Rosyth dockyard in Scotland where the ship is still in construction, but nearing completion. Captain Jerry Kyd and his 700 sailors are assembling to take the prototype warship to sea for the first time. These trials herald what should be 50 years of service
S01E01

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince: Imagine - Every Move She Makes: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way, to mark the 50th anniversary of Britain's first national trail being officially opened. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Art of Castle Building: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England
S01E02

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
