The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room
S01E03

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Glasgow: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history
S02E01

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. Paul hears from those who remember the opening ceremony, before pulling on his climbing gear to attempt the limestone cliff face of Malham Cove. He also visits a sheep sale in Wensleydale and enjoys a pint in Britain's highest pub
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Age of the Carpenter: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses
S01E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Book Signing: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E07

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Birthday Boy: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word
S01E06

programme.title: Close to Vermeer
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. The documentary follows curators, conservators, collectors and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc:
Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions
S01E02

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Pleasure & Escape: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts
S01E04

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary using archive performance footage and interviews to explore the life of Miriam Makeba, the Johannesburg-born singer and civil rights activist who was forced into exile in 1960 for opposing the apartheid regime. Miriam became one of the first South African musicians to make a name for herself on the international scene, and she used her music to deliver messages against racism and poverty

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. Paul hears from those who remember the opening ceremony, before pulling on his climbing gear to attempt the limestone cliff face of Malham Cove. He also visits a sheep sale in Wensleydale and enjoys a pint in Britain's highest pub
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Age of the Carpenter: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses
S01E03

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Pleasure & Escape: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts
S01E04

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Scottish Style: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam
S01E04

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc:
The Secrets of the South: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo
S01E01

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Big: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe
S01E02

programme.title: The Long Roads
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish woman learns she is dying of cancer, so she and her cantankerous old husband set off to visit their children - now geographically and socially miles apart - and inform them of the news. One-off drama by John McGrath, and starring Edith MacArthur and Robert Urquhart. Originally broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Tails You Win: The Science of Chance
programme.desc: Professor David Spiegelhalter tries to get to grips with chance and how it works. He tackles such questions as whether people are wise to take an umbrella when they go out, to ways of maximising the chances of living to 100, as he tries to establish if luck and fate are embedded in the fabric of the universe. Along the way, he discovers hidden patterns and shapes in a book written exclusively with numbers and explains why going sky-diving only marginally increases his risk of dying sooner rather than later

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Scottish Style: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam
S01E04

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc:
The Secrets of the South: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo
S01E01

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Big: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe
S01E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Newcastle 3/5: The third night in Newcastle sees sophisticated marketing consultant Liz trying to impress her guests with a fancy French-themed menu. However, she spends most of her time trying to keep the peace as outspoken comedy promoter David annoys club singer John and rubs mum-of-three Clare up the wrong way with his snobbish views

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
The first hosts in north London, recently engaged couple Anita and Cash, serve up a menu that draws on their Indian heritage. On day two, laughter-loving Keith and his laid-back wife Maz dish out good, honest food, but with foodie guests judging them, they're a bit worried. Dan and Les, who've been married for 17 years, host last. Self-confessed food snob Dan has devised a starter with eight separate elements. Will their risky choices and haute cuisine appeal to their guests?
S03E99

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Costa de la Luz: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of £180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: St Lucia: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of £250,000

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Retired bricklayer Paul plans to lay down new roots in Alicante, hoping to find a place where he can barbecue under sunny skies - although wife Jean's only request is a dishwasher
S05E03

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
In France, work is under way to repair the old church at a purpose-built ramshackle Catholic holiday village in France, and the owners of a hamlet wake up to find it has flooded. In Italy, the owners of an earthquake-damaged borgo find out that caring for their property is not as easy as they thought
S01E17

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen
S06E12

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 1/5: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 2/5: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 3/5: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 4/5: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham/Derby 5/5: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Lucca, Tuscany: Michelle and Bernard from Bolton first visited the stunning Italian city of Lucca a year ago and immediately fell in love with its traditional Tuscan charm and beautiful countryside. The couple now want to buy a holiday home in a nearby town or village, which they can enjoy with their whole family. Helping to fulfil their dream is Ben Hillman, who lines up five options up for their £75,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Southern Costa Blanca: Julie and Leo are looking for a holiday home to suit three generations of their family. Leah Charles-King takes them and their budget of £120,000 to the southern Costa Blanca with hopes of finding the perfect property

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Surgeons must plan their next move carefully when Daisy, a 22-month-old girl, arrives at St George's Hospital by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse at her family's stables. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mike, who has a form of medication-resistant epilepsy, arrives in minors with a bandage around his jaw after falling face-first onto the pavement. Plus, 100-year-old Florence, who was diagnosed with dementia three years earlier, and her daughter Frances arrive at the hospital when the former suffers what appears to be a stroke
S10E03

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital
S06E02

programme.title: Depp v Heard
programme.desc:
Documentary exploring the tumultuous defamation trial between Johnny Depp and his former wife Amber Heard- the first in US history to be fully broadcast live. The three-part series considers whether a jury ever be truly impartial in the age of social media. In the first episode, the couple testify about their early love story before the programme advances to some of the most dramatic moments of the trial
S01E01

programme.title: Depp v Heard
programme.desc:
As hostility to Amber Heard grows on social media, the trial reaches one of its most violent and disturbing moments. A violent confrontation between Depp and Heard as they visit Australia results in Depp losing part of his finger with Heard making a shocking allegation
S01E02

programme.title: Depp v Heard
programme.desc:
The trial reaches its climax when the jury hear allegations that Johnny kicked Amber down the stairs but testimony from one of Johnny's exes, Kate Moss, undermines the claims. The lawyers make their closing statements after hearing a disputed claim about violence on a plane and the jury retire to reach a verdict
S01E03

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson meets 34 year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him
S11E06

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc:
Another group of curious committed couples explore the possibility of opening up their relationships with sexually liberated residents. In this episode, builder Connor and full-time mother Kirstie are interested in bringing another man into their relationship and want to start the process by having a threesome. However, after connecting with resident Nathan, things go off the rails due to Connor's confidence issues. Meanwhile, married parents Chanice and Richardo, who are torn between a threesome or foursome, face an unexpected issue - finding a resident who is attracted to them
S02E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Forty-nine-year-old Nasly is brought into A&E with DKA, a life-threatening complication of diabetes, and Charlie, 72, has severe chest and back pains, although his complicated medical history proves a challenge for the medics. Emergency nurse practitioner Alison is on a busy shift, while explaining how her parents' life in Iran, and the struggles they faced during the revolution, influenced her to get into medicine
S26E02

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
Earlston House Hotel: For the third visit of the week, husband and wife Aidan and Mij Nattrass welcome their rivals to the Earlston House Hotel in Paignton, Devon
S2020E38

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Newcastle 4/5: Club singer John hopes that a menu inspired by his travels around the world will help him win the £1,000 prize as he hosts the fourth night in Newcastle. He also has a musical surprise in store for his guests, but faces a challenge trying to impress David who refused to take part in the fun and games on Liz's evening. However, further rifts appear in the group when Vicky wants to discuss Geordie icons

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Rugby: Three couples from in and around Rugby, Warwickshire, compete in the challenge. Laid-back estate agent Michael and his partner Caroline cook a fine dining menu, but party queens Soroya and Jodie aren't impressed with the main. Expectations are high that Freddie and Raj will produce a fantastic menu, but Michael and Caroline are looking for cracks in their perfect relationship. On the final night, Soroya and Jodie are determined to show their guests what they're all about - but things fail to go according to plan
S02E19

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Orlando: Sara Damergi helps Blackpool couple Julie and Brent Birnie find a holiday home close to Florida's theme park capital, Orlando. They're amazed by what their budget of £70,000 can buy them, but it remains to be seen which property will suit them best

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Antigua: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Mother-and-son estate agents Sharon and Shaun Garner help Portsmouth pair Colin and Tracy find their perfect property in Almería. With 16 years' experience, it should be plain sailing for the Garners - until they discover that Tracy was also an estate agent. So with everything to prove the pressure is on to deliver the dream. Meanwhile, in Málaga, Surrey-based fitness fan Faiz searches for a holiday home in Duquesa
S05E04

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
The owners of a ramshackle holiday village advertise for volunteers to complete their renovations and there are worrying power failures at a village in the French countryside
S01E18

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire, to meet Tom who is obsessed with motocross. Henry upcycles two Porsche wheel rims into a cool pair of stools
S06E13

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham 1/5: Marketing manager Stephanie Hale hosts the first party in Nottingham, where her guests are local councillor Alex Foster, beauty therapist Janice Overton, project engineer Brian Hodges and businessman Barry Dickman. She encounters problems when one of the diners takes a dislike to her prawns, while another has trouble identifying an artichoke

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham 2/5: Local councillor Alex Foster throws the second party in Nottingham, hoping to impress with his French menu and a spot of bell-ringing for entertainment. However, one guest likens the host's starter to cat food, while another criticises his home's tidiness

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham 3/5: Beauty therapist Janice Overton hosts a 1970s-themed dinner party in Nottingham. The guests seem to be in the mood when they arrive suitably dressed for the occasion, but they soon begin to feel uncomfortable as one of them reveals that he is not keen on a fellow diner

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham 4/5: Engineer Brian Hodges hosts the penultimate dinner party in Nottingham. Knowing his skills are limited, he decides to rope in his local butcher to help out in the kitchen, borrows cutlery from a pub and persuades a friend's daughters to waitress for him

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nottingham 5/5: Party animal Barry Dickman hosts the final dinner party in Nottingham, hoping his Greek-themed night will be enough for him to win the competition. His guests are served the country's traditional cuisine and are encouraged to dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Aegina, Greece: Lee Juggurnauth jets off to the Greek island of Aegina to help Marjory find the perfect holiday home that all her family can enjoy. She has chosen this island as it's just a ferry ride from her son and baby grandson, who live in Athens. With a budget of £150,000, Lee lines up five impressive options for her to consider

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Lizard Peninsula, 2010: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project
S10E06

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc:
Karen and Richard have a large budget but no luck when it comes to making a deal, so they enlist the help of Kirstie Allsopp in their search for a family home in the West Midlands. Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. With Nurse Camilla often working nightshifts, the pair are struggling to fit in some house hunting, after some time with Phil there are two contenders but some quick decisions must be made to avoid losing out yet again
S39E04

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc:
Tim plans to move from his small flat in Bicester into an architecturally daring home at the UK's largest mass self-build site in Graven Hill. With the help of his dad Michael, the project is supposed to be a chance to spend quality time together outside of work but the stress begins to ramp up when the five-tonne car lift Tim ordered from China doesn't fit into the specially prepared hole in the basement. Plus, Kevin and Natasha revisit Jitinder, whose house was unfinished due to the moisture problems and his resin floor last time they met, now they experience the full splendour of his Hollywood Hills style home
S03E02

programme.title: American Assassin (2017)
programme.desc: After Mitch Rapp's girlfriend Katrina accepts his wedding proposal during an idyllic European beach holiday, they and many others are gunned down by terrorists. Mitch survives and becomes a master of unarmed combat before the US government consider using him for black ops. Action thriller, starring Dylan O'Brien, Michael Keaton and Sanaa Lathan

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
A Show About Pedantry: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order
S15E09

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc:
Childhood sweethearts Natalie and Tom from Yorkshire arrive at the retreat wanting to spice up their 12-year relationship. Their mismatched sexual histories mean that Natalie arrives with a confidence that Tom might be unable to match. After a flirtatious evening leads to steamy intimacy in the hot tub with residents Josh and Holly, the couple are left questioning everything. Meanwhile, Chanice and Richardo invite 15 of the residents upstairs for an orgy, though being in a room with so many people having sex proves overwhelming for Richardo, so a once-in-a-lifetime experience seems set to pass the couple by
S02E02

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson meets 34 year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him
S11E06

programme.title: The World's Most Luxurious Holidays
programme.desc:
A VIP invitation to explore some of the most amazing hotels, villas and island escapes on the planet. This episode explores New York's Mark Hotel and its £55,000-a-night penthouse suite, where Meghan Markle held her baby shower. Next up in the Algarve, Portugal, is the £180,000-a-week Vila Azzurine, where billionaires retreat to when they are looking for some sun and sea, before embarking on a £16,000-a-night ultra-lux safari adventure at the Royal Malewane in South Africa's Kruger National Park. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi
S01E01

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:
The Beach House: The final visit is to the Beach House in Portland, Dorset, where Pete Lacey feels his back-to-basics approach offers his guests good value. But things get heated with the radiator in Karen and Liam's room and opinions are laid bare over dinner
S2020E39

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Newcastle 5/5: It is the night of the final dinner party in Newcastle and the turn of hotel administrator Vicky to entertain her guests. However, there is tension in the air and the spiritual host is challenged to keep the peace when John lets David know exactly what he thinks of him. The theme of negativity continues as mum-of-three Claire and Liz both take the comedy promoter to task over his questionable sense of humour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Bristol: Colin and Mandy kick proceedings off in Bristol with a colourful and spicy assortment of courses, while their guests are treated to a night of conversation about romantic meetings, outrageous shirts and naked gardening. Next, PJ and Owen defy expectations and create a fancy menu, but their purple potato mash is more like play-doh, while Geoff and Gemma round things off with a hearty and rich selection of courses. Who will secure the £1000 prize?
S02E36

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Barbados: Laura Hamilton helps south London couple Simone and Carlton Campbell search for a new home on Barbados. They have a budget of £150,000 and hope they can achieve their 17-year dream of moving to the island after they enjoyed their first holiday there as a couple, and returned five years later to be married

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: South Tenerife: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Estate agents the Garners and the Rodriguezes revisit some of their ex-clients to see how their property purchases and lives have been transformed since making the big move from the UK. In Almería, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun Garner catch up with naturists Brian and Hilary who wanted to escape the chilly British weather for a climate that was more compatible with their hobby, while sisters Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez re-visit Ian and Helen who were looking for a holiday home that came with rental potential
S05E05

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A family from Manchester juggles renovations and running a holiday complex in France. A couple from Kent prepare to take ownership of a village in Portugal, and the owners of a bed and breakfast in southern France tackle the exterior of their enormous new home
S01E19

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Sussex to meet Bill and Annie, who have a penchant for Star Wars collectables and most importantly, as far as Henry is concerned, motorbikes
S06E14

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 1/5: Medical insurance boss Zac Kwintner hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, making a traditional Jewish chicken soup, steak fondue and a rich chocolate orange tart. However, handing over cooking duties to his house staff does not go down well with the guests - a mature student, a travel agent, a web designer and a council worker

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 2/5: Mature student Gerry Hill hosts the second party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to spice up the competition with an Egyptian-themed feast. However, his ambitious menu prompts mixed reactions from the guests, and things go from bad to worse when dinner-table banter turns to insults, and one of the diners is forced to go home early

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 3/5: Travel agent Kayleigh Hunt hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, but her Moroccan-themed menu fails to impress the diners when she forgets to cook the main course. With all her guests hungry, she resorts to dressing up in her favourite outfits to keep them entertained

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 4/5: Web designer Marc Harris hosts the penultimate dinner party in Gloucestershire. He is confident his Spanish menu will win over his fellow diners and is determined to put a halt to Zac's rude behaviour, but his plans go downhill when he makes a mess of his starter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gloucestershire 5/5: Council worker Ameena Cott hosts the final dinner party in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress with a glamorous evening, which includes colour co-ordinating her dress to match her dog's outfit and making a birdcage centrepiece from a melon. She also tries to win her guests' affections with electric pulse-pad treatment and strawberry face masks, before the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc:
George meets James, who has bought a former glassworks in Brighton and decided to painstakingly restore the whole property, down to the very last detail. With £500,000 to spend, it should be easy - but as George soon discovers, James never does things the easy way. Will his uncompromising vision live up to his high expectations?
S02E03

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Forty-nine-year-old Nasly is brought into A&E with DKA, a life-threatening complication of diabetes, and Charlie, 72, has severe chest and back pains, although his complicated medical history proves a challenge for the medics. Emergency nurse practitioner Alison is on a busy shift, while explaining how her parents' life in Iran, and the struggles they faced during the revolution, influenced her to get into medicine
S26E02

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital
S06E02

In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives
S10E10

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Dordogne: Lecturer Maxine and paramedic team leader Cormac got married in the scenic northern region of the Dordogne in France, and now want Ben Hillman's help to find them their dream holiday home there. They have a budget of just over £100,000 and would ideally like a property with lots of outside space, just a short walk from the town of Riberac

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stoke-on-Trent: Self-proclaimed princess Tracey Durrant hosts the first dinner party in Stoke-on-Trent. She aims to use the finest ingredients, and prepares the food as quickly as possible so she has plenty of time to pamper herself and her two pet dogs before the guests arrive

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
North Somerset: Three couples in north Somerset show off their culinary and hosting skills, Norman and Dee kick things off with an Indian menu that proves too spicy for their guests, followed by young lovebirds Ashley and Sophie - although Ashley lets the side down with an un-ironed shirt. Finally, self-styled funnyman Brett and his wife Vicky end the week with an American menu
S02E49

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Davenport, Florida: Angela and Michael Sidebotham from Lincolnshire are ready to fulfil their life-long dreams of buying a home in Davenport, Florida, where they plan to spend half of each year. With a budget of £160,000, Sara Damergi shows the couple five properties that meet their requirements

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Barbados: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:

The couple have 230,000 euros to spend on a property with plenty of outside space, as they wish to prioritise al fresco living. In Alicante, Charlotte Rodriguez and her brother-in-law Damon team up for the first time to help retired Derbyshire police force pairing Lynne and Mark find a holiday home that they can eventually move to permanently

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc:
A derelict building in a French village gets a new lease of life. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple dip their toes into their first season as holiday hosts, and in southern France, a very special event takes place in a refurbished chapel
S01E20

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire to meet Bryan, who's been collecting everything and anything since childhood. Henry upcycles some old oxygen regulators into bedside lamps, while Simon settles for restoring a stylish and traditional wooden dresser
S06E15

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth 1/5: The first host in Bournemouth, 38-year-old bar manager and musician Adie, hopes to hit the right notes by ensuring his night of laid back fun is full of music and laughter. With trumpets and drums at the ready and tricky crustaceans proving hard to crack, does Adie have what it takes to win the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth 2/5: The second Bournemouth host is aristocratic vet Sir Henry, who plans to charm his way to the prize by hosting an evening of relaxed dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth 3/5: Countryside-loving Pippa from Bournemouth hopes to impress her guests by throwing a dinner party with every course inspired by fish

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth 4/5: In Bournemouth, spiritual student Simone hopes to wow her guests with a spicy Bajan menu. She's keen to impress her new friend, posh vet Sir Henry, but she's unsure about Pippa, who doesn't hold back as she probes Simone about her student house

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bournemouth 5/5: On the last night in Bournemouth, flamboyant charity manager Jacqueline hopes that Michelin star-style food will win her the prize. With partridge and black pudding scotch eggs, this could be a culinary night to remember, but will Sir Henry and Simone steal her thunder with an unlikely romance?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Western Dordogne: Janine and Mark from Stockport, Greater Manchester, are hoping to find their perfect holiday home around the western Dordogne region in France. Married for 20 years and with two grown-up children, they feel now is the right time to buy their dream home in their favourite holiday spot. Laura Hamilton tries to deliver their dreams on their budget of £230,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Costa Blanca: Recently retired Baksho wants to buy a holiday home in the resort of Gran Alacant on Spain's popular Costa Blanca. With a budget of £100,000 and her sister Sukvinder by her side to help, Jasmine Harman sets out to find Baksho the perfect family friendly property

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. Plus, 19-year-old cyclist Mack requires specialist help for a dislocated shoulder, after he collided with a Porsche. His dad explains how adopting him and his brother changed all of their lives
S10E10

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc:
With more than one million households on England's social housing waiting list, according to Shelter England's social housing deficit campaign, filmmaker Ed Stafford moves into some of the UK's most troubled housing estates for 60 days and nights, to look beyond the tabloid headlines and experience first-hand the daily hardships that locals face. In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp. He also meets a 45-year-old resident who started smoking crack at 17 and now lives alone in a housing association flat
S01E01

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E14

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including Love Is Blind, Starstruck, Cheaters, Celebrity Help! My House Is Haunted, Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad, Teen First Dates and Sophie Raworth's Sunday Morning interview with Boris Johnson. Plus, an appraisal of the coverage of the coronavirus on BBC News
S19E02

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc:
The trauma team rush to 67-year-old Walter, who has sustained a life-threatening head injury after falling down a remote hillside while walking with his sister. In Aberdeen, 62-year-old Liz has been rushed to hospital with a serious chainsaw cut to her arm, while 52-year-old Philip has crashed his motorbike at high speed and is lying in the central reservation of the motorway
S02E03

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital
S06E02

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson meets 34-year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him
S11E06

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc:
Childhood sweethearts Natalie and Tom from Yorkshire arrive at the retreat wanting to spice up their 12-year relationship. Their mismatched sexual histories mean that Natalie arrives with a confidence that Tom might be unable to match. After a flirtatious evening leads to steamy intimacy in the hot tub with residents Josh and Holly, the couple are left questioning everything. Meanwhile, Chanice and Richardo invite 15 of the residents upstairs for an orgy, though being in a room with so many people having sex proves overwhelming for Richardo, so a once-in-a-lifetime experience seems set to pass the couple by
S02E02

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc:

Guests James and Fiona rave about their room, but Martin and Petra find a few furnishing faults. At dinner, Mark gets his guests giggling, while Andrew and Qidi's revelation that they're big hitters in the five-star hotel world sends everyone's expectations sky high. In the morning, Mark's Irish breakfast gratifies the guests, but a fridge feud leaves him far from chilled
S2020E46

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stoke-on-Trent: Police officer Claire Crank hosts the second round of the contest in Stoke-on-Trent, and insists on stripping the event to the basics of good food. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Grenada: Kerry Herbert from Brighton has dreamed of buying a property on Grenada since she visited the Caribbean island as a child. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Wannabe property developers and plasterers Rees and Oliver are paired up to transform a dated terraced house bought at auction into an inviting home with curb appeal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London: Trainee aqua-aerobics instructor Jennifer Joseph hosts the second dinner party in south London, preparing a mountain of home-cooked Caribbean food and asking her guests to dress in hoodies and jeans. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London: Bricklayer Joe Kempster hosts the third dinner party in south London. He prides himself on making all his dishes from scratch and hopes to compensate for past misunderstandings with the other guests by preparing a meal featuring a mystery Greek main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London: Hospital technician Karen Hill hosts the penultimate dinner party in south London. She hopes to impress her guests by preparing seven dishes, including Chinese duck, French pate, Greek lamb, Turkish rice and American cheesecake - but the extensive menu causes her problems

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: South London: Majid Ravandi hosts the final dinner party in south London, but fails to impress with a hot prawn starter and a dry main course. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Charente, Western France: Jasmine Harman pulls out all the stops around the Charente region of western France to find Debbie and Guy a home where they can start up their own gîte business

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Orihuela Costa, Spain: Rachel and Miguel have sold their house in Dorset and are now planning a permanent move to Spain's highly sought-after Orihuela Costa, which is renowned for its gorgeous beaches and cosmopolitan environment, and where they plan to open a B&B. Jonnie Irwin shows them five properties for their budget of £165,000

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
Cheeky Jack Russell Rocco seeks a new home after his loving owner's health took a turn for the worse, setting his sights on Charnelle and Holly and their seven-year-old son Reay. However, they have their minds set on a French bulldog. Later, fur flies as Karen and Stefano meet two of Woodgreen's biggest and hairiest residents - husky brother and sister Olli and Kalli. Jess is looking for unconditional love after a recent break-up and Staffordshire bull terrier Gloria might well be the ideal buddy she needs right now
S02E02

programme.title: The Equalizer 2 (2018)
programme.desc: Robert McCall divides his time between cab driving and looking after a young man who is mixing with a bad crowd. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal and Ashton Sanders

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:

It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. Sci-fi drama, with Whitney Able and Scoot McNairy

Horror, starring Vera Farmiga and Peter Sarsgaard

programme.desc: A retired military investigator's soldier son disappears without trace shortly after returning from Iraq. Drama, starring Tommy Lee Jones, Charlize Theron and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Lock Up (1989)
programme.desc: A convict is transferred to a maximum security prison, where he falls foul of a sadistic warden with a grudge against him - and who abuses his position of power to make the inmate's life a misery and destroy his good relationship with the guards. Thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Donald Sutherland, Darlanne Fluegel and Tom Sizemore

programme.title: Monsters (2010)
programme.desc: An area of Mexico is sealed off when a space probe crash leaves it inhabited by vast alien creatures. An American photographer based in the country is given the job of escorting his boss's daughter back to the US, forcing them to make a dangerous journey through the quarantine zone and confront the personal crises they are fleeing from. Sci-fi drama, with Whitney Able and Scoot McNairy

Romantic comedy horror, with Nicholas Hoult, Teresa Palmer and John Malkovich

programme.title: Double Dragon (1994)
programme.desc: Two kickboxing brothers find half of a mystical amulet. However, the other half is in the hands of an evil tycoon who will become all powerful if he can put the two pieces together - leaving the brothers facing a deadly battle to stop him getting his hands on it. Martial arts adventure, starring Mark Dacascos, Scott Wolf and Robert Patrick

programme.title: Serena (2014)
programme.desc: A couple move to North Carolina during the Great Depression to set up a logging empire. While their business proves successful, various revelations create tension between them and ruthless ambition drives both to violent and destructive ends. Period drama based on the novel by Ron Rash, starring Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence and Rhys Ifans

programme.title: American Heist (2014)
programme.desc: A man with a shady past is planning to start his own business, but is drawn back into the criminal underworld when his brother is released from prison. The ex-convict has a dangerous plan for an elaborate bank robbery, and family loyalty drives his brother to get involved. Crime drama, starring Adrien Brody, Hayden Christensen and Jordana Brewster

programme.title: Burden (2018)
programme.desc: When a museum celebrating the Ku Klux Klan opens in a South Carolina town, the idealistic Reverend Kennedy strives to keep the peace even as he urges the group's Grand Dragon to disavow his racist past. Drama, starring Garrett Hedlund, Andrea Riseborough, Forest Whitaker and Tom Wilkinson

programme.title: The Wrestler (2008)
programme.desc: An ageing wrestler who was a big star in the 1980s is now long past his prime. When a heart attack forces him to bring his already flagging career to an end, he struggles to make a life for himself, trying to reconnect with his estranged daughter and forming a relationship with a stripper. Darren Aronofsky's drama, starring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei

programme.title: Whale Rider (2002)

Drama, with Keisha Castle-Hughes, Rawiri Paratene and Vicky Haughton

Drama, starring Tommy Lee Jones, Charlize Theron and Susan Sarandon
